author: BraunauBanani
review: I have almost 1000 hours in Forza Horizon 4. Half of it with controller and the other with a G29 Sim Racing Wheel. So obviously I love that game. But after that much time you need a different experience and that is where Forza Horizon 5 falls short. Because Forza Horizon 5 IS Forza Horizon 4. Itâ€™s the same game. Im playing the same game again. The differences are like a FIFA game. Now for a Forza Horizon that doesnâ€™t have to be necessarily a bad thing. Forza Horizon 4 was after all an almost 10/10 game. The only things that it had to improve was its sense of speed, proper spots for dirt rally on the map a GOOD CITY maybe some better mountains for more offroad fun, Hill and Downhill races. It also had a lot off small things like the shifting stile being a difficulty setting (very annoying with a wheel) and its rater suboptimal class system. But Forza 5 changes none of that.Actual significant changes Pros:Better sense of speed thangs to ssdMore realistic car feel (better weight feel)Better Force Feedback (Sim Wheels)Much better car soundsCons:Terrible and uncreative map when compared to Forza 4No seriously it ruins the gameA lot less cars than Forza 4 (for now at least)More bugs than cyberpunk (mostly coop related)Conclusion: When you play with a controller just play Forza Horizon 4. The Force Feedback doesnâ€™t affect you and the weight feel doesnâ€™t do all that much. The map is worth it. When you play with a wheel and you canâ€™t get enough off Forza or never played 4 before than the Force Feedback might be worth it or you just play assetto corsa.

author: Stavinsky
review: I bought the game last year in November, and got through the whole story and unlocked almost all cars that were accessible by January 2022. The pro :- Nice visuals- Enjoyable driving experience when alone on the roads- Love the designing tool (compared to The crew 2)- Love to be able to fine tune my car to my preference.The Cons- Grindy as hell- Nerf after nerf of the various ways to earn money- Some of the challenges are painfull, especially when having to compete against cheating AI.All in all, when played with friends (and the game keep in sync) it's nice and fun. Enough that I got 300 hours sunk into the game. So why the thumbs down ? Here is why :I did a 6 months break from the game, and decided I just wanted to take one of my car for a spin 2 days ago.I had the game using 100GB on my hard drive for the last 6 months, got the updates and all. But when I started it, reached the login to my Microsoft Xbox account, and then started the game, I got the nasty surprise to be presented with the Driver creation option and not being sent in my previous game.So here I am, 300 hours down the drain and having lost every singles of my achievements.After a bit of searching, I found out it's a common issue both on PC and console. A lot of players get corrupted save or error codes. In my situation I got nothing of such, no warning, no error code, just a complete reset of the user data save file.Now, after contacting the support I have to replay the Tutorial and reach the point that let a player go online. The very part I hate in every game who Gate the access to your friends through "Tutorials" and other mandatory things before you can join your friends online and can enjoy playing with them.Hate to have to do it a first time, or every single time a game decide you lost your datas (GTA 5, Dying Light, Forza Horizon 4 and 5). So, having lost everything, and not even sure I can get the rewards for the various Skins I made for a lot of car and shared online, I can't in good faith put anything else than a thumb down.

author: cow
review: Just get gamepass and play it there. You can play a $60 game for $1. For an actual review, Forza Horizon 5, once again, breaks it's own barriers. With an gigantic map that is full of twisting biomes and roads, it encapsulates a great and mesmerizing atmosphere of Mexico. Coming from past Forza games, the latest entry to the Horizon series is the best that Playground Games has churned out. The monumental changes to the lighting and particle effects are wonderful, the increased graphical fidelity and saturation of the world is great, and the new changes to how vehicles both handle and respond to the environment are perfect. The only "but" I would say is that, as of both pre-launch and after, the game has issues with crashing randomly when in a menu or trying to interact with the UI. I've also gotten into issues where I would get stuck into an endless online match search where I wouldn't be able to interact with the menu, but as far as I know, that issue has been resolved. These are minor in comparison to the solid and polished recipe for the king of arcade open world driving games.9/10

author: 108_TehZharpRazor
review: The best open-world racing game out right now. Played a bit of Forza Horizon 4 and enjoyed it a lot, and I have been super excited for the sequel to that game, which is this game, and it delivers. Amazing graphics as to be expected, but it's still just breathtaking to look at. This games open-world aspect is jam-packed with content, just race after race, and not just that, there are more than just your typical road racing which spices things up, and keeping it fresh for us the players, so we keep coming back for more. This game just fit every racing game play-style, You want to race and reach the top? go for it. You just want to drive around the map chilling whilst listening to your Spotify playlist? go for it. You want to create your own crazy wacky races? go for it. Love this game and I highly recommend it.

author: `Xjiei
review: This is going to be a review from a person who has thousands of hours and I mean like around 3000 of hours in TDU 1 and TDU 2, and not only I am car enthusiast in real life since early age this is my first Forza game so it is how I get to meet the franchise. At this point I am level 117 and almost finished all horizon events on the map, raced in most of the races on the map and drove most of the coolest cars that this game has to offer, so I felt like it is a good time to leave this game a fair review ( at the given moment, as updates come out I will remove and re update my review with new information). Besides I am going through some problems with my secondary SSD which is problem at my end, so I wanted to post a review while my feeling from the game still not affected by anger nor disappointment. game is amazing but quick warning before we get to the review:Many people have low streaming bandwidth which freezes the game and crashes, I experienced it on my SSD which may be faulty and game now being tested on another drive ( will update the review later). But all I can say dev team already works on solution not to mention that I personally reported and contacted support 2 times and both times was greeted by real person who offered help and solutions. How about that? A game dev company that actually values their customers and lets a real person help them out. Some other companies should take good example! Convoy with friends doesn't work as expected, losing connection to each other, patch is in the progress scheduled for this week.Graphics: we will just leave it at that, they are incredible, I was actually very surprised that my i7-920, 18GB, 1070 G1 gaming GTX was automatically adjusted to Ultra settings and yes the game runs very good on 1080p resolutions, nearly perfect on 1080i. Extreme settings is when it starts having some FPS drops. Driving Physics: As someone who comes here from TDU games, the physics are very good. There is one downside to discuss down the review tho, but not here. Cars behave very realistically, understeer, oversteer, you gotta learn your braking zones, acceleration sensation is fantastic and high speeds really feel like high speeds. Your driving can be adjusted by ABS, traction Control, stability assist, and there is simulation mode which really ups the feeling up with cars behaving incredibly real. You can have fun with the simulation even with a keyboard as far as some of the assists are on and you at least half not stupid when it comes to driving. And you gonna love it (sorry, I had to) Customization and car selection: I was very happy that we didnt get spammed by bunch of new super cars, car selection is more than amazing. You have some old cars from the 90s and even 80s and even classic cars and muscle cars. Many of those can be engine swapped to racing I6 or racing V8 with 1000+ hp that will make it mad fun to drive. Ford has amazing line up in this game, you have Fiesta ST and Focus RS that can be turned into Rally cars, mustangs, amazing Trucks that easy turn into Baja beasts, or even new bronco that be swapped with a racing engine at 1400hp, top it off by Ken Blocks hoonigan Stang that probably one of my favorites car in the game with insane straight line performance and possibility to be driven at grip or drifting.There are a lot of old school and modern american sport muscle cars overall which really made it for me and nice older cars such older m5 and m3 and whats not....AMG ONE and VULCAN AMR are absolutely incredible, amazing demonstration of physics and grip around the corners. What a pleasure to drive!Everything can be customized, you can adjust your beasts to straight line performance, drifting or turn into real cornering race car. Wide body's that give huge grip bonus, or the other way around remove any aero and just rip it on the straights. or do a mix of both and than you really have to learn your car, its breaking zones and its limit on the corners. Map: if you coming from TDU 2, think of it as Ibiza on a whole new level. You have one long highway in the middle of the map where you can enjoy some top speed runs, than a lot of smaller roads around the map. But those roads really designed well, it is a mix of straights and corners where you have to constantly adapt as you drive and really get used to your car. The terrain is incredible, as you cruise around the map you go in the mountains, forest and desert, constantly climbing, speeding downhill or just enjoying the bends. On really fast car it takes about 15-20min to circle the map, but than you can keep circling vertically and through other roads. There is also a huge volcano with amazing hill climb section to get there that already occupied by ppl drifting there 24/7 and they are pretty good at it. Very fun to just watch em do it. The runways next to Horizon event in the deserts is already full with people challenging each other with drag builds. Online experience: any driver that is not on your convoy is a ghost for you. So yesss finally you cannot collide with each other yet you still see each other. Once you join the convoy you are no longer ghosted and up to 12 people can be in one convoy together. You can complete races in co-op, and you and your friends get rewarded no matter who was first who second, or you can go PVP vs other people. If you ramming during races you become ghosted for some time until you cool it down, and you wouldn't even be able to draft on the slipstream. Ai in races is nasty! It is very difficult to beat which makes it more fun. What is more fun AI will always match your car! So you can enjoy any type of race with any type of cars with opponents driving same equal cars.So with good things out of the way lets focus on the bad things:Some tuned are ridiculous and will easily allow cars to reach 500km\h or 300mph in ridiculous low amount of time...its fun but not as I would like to see it.Still connection issues for convoy, so the best solution is to co-op some long race after which you and your friends will stay with each other in the session even if you change cars...dont know why or how but it seems to work...Still some performance issues with the game , low streaming bandwith textures, freezes in the game, crashes. Hopefully get fixed this week as promised. A very impressive game, for a real car enthusiast to enjoy. That once gets fixed and patched will probably be perfect.Also, wanted to add the Horizon events races missions, are very creative and enjoyable. Also, the Baja races those did it for me. I am a circuit kind of a person, but maaan those Baja races are really take you to this Horizon atmosphere and maaaaad fun....

author: Zentak
review: In short: if you liked Forza Horizon 4 then you will love the 5th, buying it is a no-brainer.There is a new Smactus skill, and PiÃ±ada smashing. Buy it.Ok, seriously, if you don't know FH 4/5, it is an arcade open world car racing game which has some bits of simulation in it but is definitely not a realistic sim. In this game you can chose between a wide range of activities such as road/dirt/drag/country racing, beat records on speed traps or try a 1000ft jump on a danger sign. You can also just roam the road and enjoy the scenic views, and smash a few cardboards collectibles.The 5th comes with improved graphics and it is gorgeous, the environment is packed with a lot of details which brings life to the world. This time the action is in Mexico which allows for even more variety than previous England: seaside, desert, jungle, volcanic mountain, Maya ruins there is a lot to enjoy. The weather system has been improved with thunderstorms and sandstorms: obviously since it is the first week I have only seen Spring season, so I can't comment on Winter for instance.There are new and really nice volumetric smoke/particle effects: I like how when driving in the dirt, the trail of dust behind the car gets illuminated in red when hitting the brakes. It's one of those small details that make you nod in approval. There is just one silly thing with that: if you happen to be in a drift event in a Forzathon with 3+ cars drifting you won't see the road anymore because of the smoke: I am sure this will be adjusted later. The team is very reactive and already fixed in 1 day an issue with network connections.The lights also have been greatly improved. However the RTX is only working in the static view of the car, not in the open world. It honestly doesn't matter much, the lights are amazing in the Mexican night, but still worth saying.The physics are also improved and objects such as rocks or cacti are now bouncing more realistically. The feedback has been improved on the controller with added feedback for braking and is now more fine grained for drifting and off-road. All the controller dead-zones can also be adjusted in the settings.Also worth noting are the accessibility options: the game speed can be changed, the palette adjusted for different types of color blindness, adjustable subtitles, screen reader and even text-to-speech and speech-to-text can be activated in the settings. Good to see that this is not an afterthought and is well integrated in the game, and hopefully this will inspire other studios.So to summarize, this is an excellent casual car racing game that you can play the whole winter and then some more, coming back to it every week to play solo or online with friends and never get tired of it. And there are also 2 DLC coming.

review: Avoid this if you are thinking of "stepping up" from forza 4. DLC will not display, which is something that I guess could be solved. However, graphics are a disaster. Yes, the environments look fantastic, but the cars display in mario brothers era quality. In the menus as well as in-game. The new menu structure and changes to what things are called also make little sense. If they sort the car graphics there is a case to argue for Forza 5. Until such time, anyone looking for a nice racing sim ought to just stick with Forza 4.

author: Ya Im Bad and What
review: It leaves me speechless that Fanatec wheel support is still completely broken. Why do we have to downgrade to 6+ month old wheel drivers and put the wheel in compatibility mode just to play? When did this game come out again and it's April? I never leave reviews but i wish i could either get a clear communication and firm ETA on a fix OR a refund for this incomplete product.

author: Flower
review: This is exactly like Forza Horizon 4, but better. I love how they kept the same formula. Just like the previous game, the game is well optimised despite looking so good. Cars sound MUCH better than Horizon 4, but also not the best out there. Still, a massive upgrade. They listened to the community feedback which is always nice for a game studio. However, I can still feel some "recycled" audio from cars to cars. Not a massive drawback but what can you expect when you have over 500 cars in the game. The game gives all the flexibility that you want when playing. Do you want a drag car? Drift car? Road racing car? Just relax and cruise? Anything is possible. Building up your car collection is easy as well. A bit grindy, but not so much. There's also multiple different race type and arcades that you can play. You can create/customise races as you want and even go as far as adding obstacles and stunts (GTA 5 style). For car customisation, I would say the only sad thing is that they removed all the Rocket Bunny kits from Horizon 4, but at the same time, we still got some new kits (Liberty Walk, Duke Dynamics, RWB, SSWORKS, Streethunters, TCP Magic, Varis, HKS, some Forza Originals and some fenders) and many more to discover (added content). They also added a new wing for many cars and the ability to space your wheels. I just wish they were more customisation but again, having 500+ cars is not an easy feat. At least the main or most popular cars got some nice available mods. They made some improvement on the in-game designer for all the people creating Itashas or any crazy design/logo.The map is okay. They made the roads very fun for a racing game. The only thing I hate is that it's missing buildings. You will find a lot of forest, dirt and sand but not enough "town". Driving all those crazy super/hyper/modded cars on a nature focused map feels out place sometimes. It's like they added more love to cross-country/dirt races and not so much for the street scenes. The map still looks amazing visually on maxed out. Knowing how they operated in the past, I am expecting a lot of upcoming great content. The game has a lot of room for improvement and I do not regret my purchase. Overall, the game is amazing and I recommend it for everyone.

author: Jayton ;)
review: This is the tragic story of the Forza Horizon 5 launch in my perspective. So this game started off very well! I was a happy car boi for just under 2 hours. Then as buddies do, we start up a convoy to cruise in our first vehicles we've purchased and built. This is where I immediately, slid on a downhill slope that returned me to the shadow realm of being a sad car boi once again. This was the first time in my life I've witnessed a car just slowly disappear into thin air, and not only was it just one of my buddy's cars, it was all of them. And then there I was, connected with friends online but not really because once again I found myself driving alone. Depression is setting in as I realize that I had just pre ordered this game for 100 dollars, and the game barely works at all when it comes to online features. I will end on this, the game is very fun and the graphics are a sight to behold, but my god please fix your servers. My friends and I are tired of being sad.

author: Zat0ne [GT]
review: My feelings for this game are similar to the awesome experience with Forza Horizon 4. A fun, beautiful, somewhat-arcadey experience with tons of cars and beautiful locations. Tons of activities and great tunes. Of course, I love taking in-game photos, so this was an auto-buy for me.I do hope they fix all the multiplayer problems though. I've got a few friends I'd love to convoy with and so far it's been a hit-and-miss affair, with mostly misses. They already have the problems on their known issues list, so here's hoping they get fixed before my pals move on to something else.Otherwise, this is still a must-own game for fans of the series, and casual racing fans like me. Although high level play is really up there and always awesome to watch. I hope this trend of ports to Steam continues for us who are region-locked away from getting these games from the MS Store.

author: Princess Phoenix
review: You know when a game starts off really strong, but gets dragged down by issues that have existed since launch and never get fixed?That's the story of Forza Horizon Five. Multiplayer in this game has been in a sorry state since day one, and while it has received some improvements, it's still a mess, with desync and absurdly long loading times abound. And, instead of fixing that, we get updates with stuff like nerfing wheelspins(which is your main way of earning money in this game). Which is a shame, because the actual driving and wealth of cars is really fun. That's not the only issue with the game though. It also has a really bad "campaign" if you can call it that. The writing is pretty bad, and everytime a character calls me superstar it just makes me cringe. Let me make this clear though, the game is not bad. It's actually pretty aight. But it isn't worth 60$. Playing Horizon 3 or 4 is probably the way to go.

There is no way of me playing FH5 again.

author: brusli
review: Forza Horizon 5 is a rich and intricate vehicle heaven where revheads and auto geeks may gather, tinker, and explore indefinitely. It's a sentimental homage to the thrill of road-tripping through postcard-perfect holiday scenery, and an occasionally silly but always genuine Valentine to Mexico's world-famous culture. It's a long-distance, MMO-inspired racer that's bursting at the seams with more races, events, and event kinds than can reasonably fit on some portions of the map â€“ but it never seems overwhelming. It never forces you to do something you don't want to do and consistently rewards you for your choices. It has a lovely appearance, a fantastic tone, and is a joy to play. Forza Horizon 5 is a lot of things, to be sure. Above all, it's the work of a master racing company, and it's the greatest open-world racing game I've ever experienced.

author: Taras Buria
review: This is a racing game, for gods sake, why the AI cars have rocket-boosted engines and 200% grip? Don't get me wrong, this game is fun to cruise around (alone or with friends), collect cars, watch scenery, etc. But racing with AI? No way, simply annoying, infuriating, and absolutely unbeatable, even on lower difficulty settings. You need to constantly smash that rewind button and watch out for cars overtaking you outta nowhere at +100 mph speed. Driving the OP Lamborghini Sesto Elemento FE? Look that Jeep Trailcat wrecking you in a sharp turn or a straight line.And yes, there are lots of bugs. If you do not care about exclusive cars in early series, give devs a couple of months to fix this game (or try, at least).

review: The game has issues with the multiplayer part of the game, which will probably be ironed out shortly. That aside, it is a fantastic game. If you like arcade-y driving games, you can't do much better. I put 20 hours into the early access, and I had a really good time, and didn't experience any annoyances other than multiplayer, which is a very small part of the game for me.

author: Kortie
review: UPDATE: As of Dec 15th they've patched all the crashes I was running into, I appreciate that they took the time to fix most of the issues from launch. I still however believe it would've been in their best interest to fix these issues BEFORE launching. I will however change my review to a thumbs up as I can at least play the game.In it's current state I don't recommend you buy this game full price. I do however say go ahead and try GamePass to try the game and see if it's for you. The game released NOV 8th and as I am writing this review it's currently November 16th and this "hotfix" to fix all the performance issues and crashes just keeps getting pushed back further and further. First we were told by the end of the first week of release, the 12th goes by and we get an update saying "next week", well I expected early next week since they claimed the hotfix was almost ready, here we are on tuesday and we're being told we'll have an UPDATE later this week. Are we getting an UPDATE or the actual HOTFIX? There is no worse feeling in a racing game to be 12 MINUTES into a race and have your game crash in the last quarter. Oh yeah sure blame a couple 3rd party apps for the crashes... nothing like trying to divert blame when it's obviously your fault the game crashes constantly. Even cyberpunk 2077 which was seemingly buggier than this game I was able to get over 30 hours of gameplay CRASH FREE. FIX THE CRASHES PLEASE.

author: Ollie!
review: PROS:- Huge car roster. 500+ cars at launch. - Amazing roads and scenery. Mexico is probably one of the best maps in the series, if not in any open world racing game ever. - Fun side stories. - Amazing sound design. Huge step up from Forza Horizon 4 all around.- Variety (Street Racing, Mixed Surface Racing, Offroad Racing, PR Stunts, Stories, Expeditions, Battle Royale, Playground games, Livery customization, Custom race building, etc. etc.) - Dynamic and engaging driving physics. - Tuning. You can upgrade a car's performance anyway you want and make it do anything. You can make a cross country monster out of a Ferrari FXX and a quick circuit racer out of a 1956 Ford F-100. The freedom is paralleled - BMW Isetta CONS:- Horrible online. Every mode is riddled with bugs, server issues, long load times, and a lack of freedom. I have had to restart my game at least 15 times due to being frozen in a menu. - Rendering issues. - Horizon Arcade. It's such a step down from previous games that it baffles me. - No Custom Adventure. If you want to race online, you can't pick what class you want to race in or what type of racing you want to do. It was in Forza Horizon 4, why is it gone now? - No peel :(Overall it's definitely a great game, a solid 9/10 when it works, just be aware that if you're purchasing this just for the online it may be better to wait until those are fixed.

author: Desi
review: how do you â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ up multiplayer this badly when forza horizon 4 is literally the same game and should be able to share most if not all of the netcodethe game series is going through its codification phase where its the same exact mind numbing experience every time but this time they shuffle up the content roster a bit. absolutely no rewarding progression, just infinite money with zero feeling of accomplishment for getting any expensive cars. they even stopped making you chose one starter car, they give you all 3 of the options now in case you thought you'd ever have to think playing this game. they took out most of the interesting cars this time so theres really not a lot to chose from that isnt a dedicated sports or supercar.literally feel myself losing brain cells due to inactivity while playing this. i feel no draw to come back after dropping it, theres nothing to really work towards. this game will be forgotten as soon as the followup comes out, just like 4 has been for this.probably a really good game if you've 1. never played a forza game before and 2. arent a car person but if you fall into either of those categories the game is not going to be enjoyable. theres too little new from the previous game and too little challenge or variety to make you give a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥.the map is actually really good and full of fun driving roads but it feels like a waste.i preordered this but its so disappointing im going to hold of on a horizon 6 and probably wont even buy it unless i hear after release they've actually made it a game again and not a tool for reminding me my life is slowly slipping from my fingertips.this is just such a nothing of a game and i feel so bad for all of the effort thats gone into designing the actual good parts thats just been wasted because playground games thinks people have more fun if they never have to think ever

The list goes on, i really hope that they release a big fix like they say they will. I still love forza but this is just getting out of hand.

author: Marshmallow
review: TLDR:This is an uninspired reskin of Horizons 4 and I could not in good conscience recommend it.Review:The game still suffers from various bugs and exploits that have plagued the last few horizon titles. As per usual, playing with friends in the open world and in races often results in disconnects promoting a frustrating time at best and at worst the desire to completely quit due to the inability to finish a single race. The lead drivatar still outpaces the rest of the race making it next to impossible to win on higher difficulties without driving like a total scum bag. The worst offense of all though is the laughable level of security which is on par with every other horizon title. You are still able to connect CheatEngine to the game and exploit credits, xp, and your car collection without fear of repercussion. Even worse is the fact that there are already a dozen or so publicly available cheat tables to automate this to an extent and multiple trainers. This has lead to compromised leaderboard validity, the inability to play pvp due to untouchable exploited clients, and a growing disinterest in the game as the rampant and blatant use of exploits continues unhindered for the fifth time.When players are driving around in unreleased unobtainable cars two weeks after launch that's when enough is enough. I fail to see what Playground Games and Turn 10 spent the extra development time on here. This game at it's core is nothing more than a reskin of the last title with a few new gimmicks taped on and a few old systems overhauled and rebranded as "new".If you want to do some solo racing, then it's good enough for that, but if you are looking for anything more, I would search somewhere else. With the egregious failure of security, distasteful gimmicks, borderline manipulative "overhauls", and complete lack of innovation or iterative improvement of any kind, it is impossible for me to recommend this game in it's current state or for it's current price. If you want to experience this game, go pick up Horizons 4 for a fraction of the price.

author: FrosTytheNoob
review: This is my first Forza game like ever. Coming from someone who played countless need for speed let me tell you this:The customization in here is insane. Engine swaps, body kits, community made liveries... all here. If that does not convince you, the game allows you to tweak it based on your driving style. You want full arcade? NO PROBLEM. You want a harder game with simulation physics? NO PROBLEM.But the most important thing for me is optimization. This game can run on a potato. That shows love and care from the devs. The only issue here is that the AI needs to be tweaked a bit since they do not brake in corners and will overtake you majority of the time.The graphics here are also insane. I have an RTX 2060SUPER nad I am just awe struck. The openworldness of the game is the cherry on top.

author: MIULOS
review: Not a fan of:- The general "party" atmosphere- Elevating the player to superstardom from the very start, constant superficial praises even if you're crashing into walls- Ridiculous Hollywood stunts- Unskippable cutscenes when I'm just trying to get a quick feel of the gameThe game looks good and I'm sure it's fun for the intended audience, but unfortunately I'm not part of that audience. This feels like GTA V without all the crimes and with real cars instead. I'd really rather be playing GTA V in this case.Since this really comes down to personal taste, can't say I recommend this game or not. If you enjoy sim racing, this is not the game for you. If you want to feel like a billionaire playboy superstar in a Hollywood racing movie, you'd feel right at home.

author: pixelito
review: The concept of the game still the same as the olders Forza Horizons but with better graphics, a few more new features, more cars and a bigger map. Sadly I can't give a positive review because of a few negative aspects. Some accolades are way too hard to accomplish, you need luck, or spend way too much time learning/doing something or both at the same time, like the tunning ones or the paintings. And the biggest problem this game has is the fact that they remove every trace of competition from it. There is no point of playing the game once you have unlocked almost every car in the game, you have enough credits to buy or upgrade anything other than doing the weekly activities list. Every game mode is casual, there is no point of playing them, especially the Horizon racings, recently they added some levels to upgrade on Horizon Open and get some stickers on your name but still no rankings. Without a ranking system means that all the players are mixed together and it's very likely to play against people who is way better than you.

author: Resortas
review: Awesome game! The map Mexico brings a lot of diversity to the environment "eye candy graphics". The car details are on point, cars sound & feel good. Fun stories and cool showcases with spectecular races. Overall the game is made with an everyone wins mindset that doesnt break the game or feels disturbing.The wheelspins give you a good dose of dopamine too :).Excellent game 9.8/10Game feels arcade in terms of progression you unlock the best or most wanted cars pretty easy with compromises. AI opponents are very broken going around a 90 degree corner with 200KM/h just to catch up or give you unwinnable competition on higher difficulties.

author: CYBERDYNE10I
review: CLOUD SAVE DATA VANISHED, 659+ HOURS OF GAMEPLAY, GONE!!!! Now forced to start again?!?!?! For the first time I had to uninstall steam and in-turn Forza had to be uninstalled (due to many issues, figured a clean install of both programs may help and it did as far as performance, 20+FPS but...). I felt like throwing-up after I clicked uninstall (had a oh sh#t moment about not knowing the location of the cloud save file) and it was too late. Re-installed both programs, signed into steam which was showing my 600+ hours, achievements etc... all was looking good. Fired up Forza in steam, signed into game, signed into the pop-app side xbox app, everything linked and NSYNC.  Was thinking, sweet, all gravy cannot wait to race online wiith an extra 20+FPS on my brand new 4K monitor.... I hit continue at Forza home screen... FBR!!! BACK TO THE START OF THE GAME!!!!! Gutted! I couldn't really give 2F's about my campaign progression or even my rank for that matter, but my CARS!!!!! My legitimately  owned  cars!!!! I had every high-end car, that I wanted anyway, including my pride and joy, the NSX R GT!!!! Took me weeks to finally find one in the auction and actually bid at the right time to get it!!!!!! This car cant ever be obtained again, unless it's auctioned by accident! It sucks cause truth be told, as of recent, I finally found form and was placing in the last 11 races and then this happens to me. I could live without my rank and progress.... but, MY CARS I cannot! I requested a full refund due to this, as there is nothing more I can do. Funny enough, it says if you have put in a substantial amount of hours into the game, a refund may not be possible. Given steam conveniently shows the logged hours that will be the loop whole to reject refund request, Even though, I'm forced to start again with NOTHING!!!!! Anyway, Id be happy to start from scratch, provided that all my cars can be restored, at the very least, my NSX R GT. All I ever play is multiplayer and even if I sucked it up and started again, it would take me a year to get the garage of cars I had, and competing with average cars until then will be painful knowing I had the top end cars to compete in the first place! Steam, if you are reading this, please help me, I raised a ticket and tried all your troubleshooting methods to no avail.

author: KonaKonda
review: I was really hyped for this game and at launch I really enjoyed this experience. Surely when you have maybe half of featured cars it will become a little boring but there's always something to do like grinding cash for another expensive car and etc. But right now it's starting to become like usual gatcha mobile game... Compared to Horizon 4 (stopped playing after horizon 5 launch and had almost full car collection not counting FE), the grind was not that very scary, you could just do anything and still manage to get millions without noticing it. For this title, right now skill points are limited to 10 while (if I remember correctly) forza 4 didn't had this limitation, rewards become definitely smaller (rewards are a joke right now) and drivavatars are so overpowered that it's impossible to drive normally and you have no other choice but ram to them and just slide with walls to pass them and hopefully finish first. Maybe it needs some time for drivavatars to learn tracks and so on, but it really makes them look unnatural when they are unmovable and have unlimited grip and acceleration that makes you frustrated. I haven't tried multiplayer that much but I heard that there exists cheaters (at least I haven't met one). And at least for me I don't see any point anymore to play further this game. It become just logging in for Forzathon event, get points to receive event featured cars and wait another week for another event, just like other gatcha game...Talking about graphics, it looks really gorgeous... if you watch a youtube video of someone playing this game on console. I'm using GTX 1080 and I tried so many solutions, but it still looks very crappy, Draw distance are very noticeable that it's just pain to look at it and overall I don't really see anything special. Forza 4 on the other hand looks better than this on my machine, so I'm guessing this is a issue with PC release because I'm not the only one with these kind of "features".Overall, I would not recommend this game for now, better buy forza 4 on sale (if they didn't nuke progression like they did for forza 5). I can't see a really good future for this game with these kind of changes, so my suggestion for developers would be fix their priorities, fix graphical bugs, fix AI, make game more enjoyable and worth your time so we could have a reason to play it every day (no heavy grind please).

review: Greatly Optimized overall and Mexico looks amazingly detailed!Gameplay:- Forza/10 ( Handling also felt great even though i played in simulation mode.)Audio:- 9/10 (This time they fixed the engine sounds and different cars sounds great and original.)Graphics & Detail:-  10/10 ( In one word amazing. A racing game having this much Detailed environment feels like wizardry.)Also the driver character now talks. So finally the character has more dept as he replies to other characters.

author: GH
review: A worthy successor to FH4.After about 50h of playtime i completed most of the default "singleplayer" races and most speed traps etc. I still have about 50% of the "stories" left and hundreds of challenges and things I can still collect. It's clear that they tried to put a heavier focus on the multiplayer aspect of the game, by making it easier to invite strangers to a race and join a lobby. The general scheme of the game stayed the same, it seems they focused on improving upon the previous game, than trying to make crazy changes, which worked well. They do seem to have gotten rid of competitive multiplayer though (or I didn't find it yet).Unfortunately Alfa Romeo/Fiat are gone due to licensing issues (thank you Stellantis), which is a shame, but they might be added back later like Mitsubishi and Toyota were in the previous title. With that said, this is still probably the biggest car inventory of any new racing game on the market. The audio of the cars (which was a big complaint of the previous title) has noticeably improved, though it depends on the model.The map is very large and has many unique areas to explore. Finally there are some long straight roads to max out your cars, but there are also many bends and turns to make for some good races. It's also much bigger than Scotland; after my current playtime I've been to every corner but still don't know every road. I spotted a few visual bugs here and there, but nothing that annoys me too much (floating fences and so on). The graphics are just like the previous title -- amazing, just look at the screenshots.The soundtrack is okay, some songs I like and some I don't. In my opinion it could be bigger and have more variety for a game whose setting is a Festival. Sure, you can always have Spotify or some other thing playing on the side, but it won't be as well integrated. Also, if you turn the sound off, it will stay off (even after you restart the game), unlike the previous title. Overall I recommend this game, if you're looking for an arcade racer with a lot of stuff to explore. I bought it for ~50â‚¬ on sale which is fine, for what it offers. (I always try to keep my games below 0,50â‚¬/h of playtime and I'm pretty confident I can reach 100h in this one without getting bored.) I probably missed some things in this review, just because there's so much to this game, but for now that's all I have to say.Update 11/2022: The game has enjoyed regular content updates, same as the previous title (if not better). Each update introduces new-to-the-game or new-to-the-series cars and sometimes even new stories, hence I nominated it for the "labour of love" award.

author: Run
review: As of right now I can't recommend. I'm not sure if it's my drivers or the game itself but unless I'm driving in-game it crashes, no matter what I do in Menu's like customisation, certain cars and certain parts like specific paint colours and wheels etc just crash the game once you try to apply them to your car its pretty much unplayable unless I just buy the car, keep it stock and start driving it. This isn't what I asked for when paying Â£80 in a Triple A game made by a well established Company that SHOULD know what they're doing by now..I mean come on it's been Months since Launch and I crash twice within 10 minutes of playing.. Also since Forza Horizon 3 the public have been asking for more customisation yet they feel the need to ignore that which should be a very fundamental part of the game, and instead add useless features like Pronouns and Prosthetics so they can push this "diversity" move on the consumer to make themselves look good. No offence to anyone it's a point that the company doesn't genuinely care about you it's just about their image. NFS Heat came out like 5 years ago and you can customise Camber, Tyre Stretch, Tinted Lights, Exhaust Sound/Flames, Side mirrors, Exhaust Tips, Actually lower a car to the ground, Bumpers on every Car not just Forza Bumpers etc etc.

author: DashieDragon
review: I would love to leave a perfect review for Forza 5 like i normally do for the entire Horizon series. But i cant. I cant upgrade my cars because it crashes instantly, I cant stay connected to any players at all, and when i do connect i crash. Now i dont have a piece of garbage PC. My specs are well above the required, and no other game gives me a headache except not very optimized games. With that being said, dont waste your money on this game until they fix the issues. Im not the only one with these problems. I am in a group of people trying to figure out the issue and how to fix it with zero luck. my entire play time is literally sitting in menu trying to see if settings are broken thats causing my issues or if it might be something else. good luck if you buy this game and actually expect to enjoy it. i sure as hell dont

author: Aelita
review: I think this is the greatest arcade racing game there is. Far better than any nfs (except for the lack of cops). Graphics are amazing. Reminds me of BDO but much better!I totally recommend this game to anyone into arcade racing at the highest level of polish and detail.I won't upvote this game simply because it's lacking in 2 aspect that are very important for me personaly, so don't take them to heart.The first one is plot/writting. This game has the cringiest dialogs I've experienced. Seems like they tried to make as safe for work as possible, even when they are talking to street racers. Everyone is very bland. Also everyone calls you "superstar" and praise you everytime you race, which is embarrassing. It's like they think you are some sort of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ and they feel sorry for you.The other aspect are the avatars. Everyone who knows me knows I like working with girl beauty ideals and trying to explore its reaches and aesthetic values/symbolisms (like how the color palette of the face can affect the compatible color palette for makeup, clothing and even hair). In a nutshell, avatars for girls in this game are dreadful. Even though they copy pasted the same racial archetypes from FH4, I can't understand why they made them look way worse than before. The eyes are almost popping out, yet eyes are smaller. Girls lack makeup. The skin is darker for all races. My favorite girl of HF4, the south eastern asia looking, has an off puting smile fixed in her face. I'm afraid to think they intentionally did these downgrades to imply they are more latin american now, but it's a possibility.I just make her wear a covid mask to avoid looking at her weird grin and I keep enjoying the game very much, always wondering if the devs ever going to fix the avatar, but not letting that take away from my experience.

author: 'Jake'
review: Absolute masterpiece.I cannot believe they somehow improved Horizon 4.  Handling: My friends and I were skeptical at first that they were tinkering with the handling because it was so precise in previous titles, but they added a weighty feeling to all the cars that make you actually use the brakes and be cautious of spinouts. It feels much better now. Setting: Cannot be happier with the choice of Mexico. The landscapes capture the richness of the jungles and the barrenness of the desert/dunes perfectly. They've spread the events and progression well in my opinion. It may seem like the map is overloaded with things to do, but they are giving you all the freedom to do what you want. Use the map filter if you want to focus on certain things, it is there for good reason. Graphics: Beautiful, possibly better than real life. 11/10. Ultimate edition has been worth every single penny so far AND still have 2 unannounced DLC's in the oven. Cannot wait to see what else Playground has in store.

author: Moose
review: Unpopular opinion, but after owning Horizon 2, 3, and 4, all of those games are significantly better than this game, and I think it comes down to the map, and the way this game works. There are way too many things to unlock in this game, so much so that it's overwhelming. This may sound like a good thing, but it's not. None of them provide any benefits. Also, you start off with a top tier car. That's stupid to me. I'd rather they port a version of Horizon 3 over here. This map is all bare desert, it is the worst aspect of this game. The Horizon 4 map is the best in my opinion, save for the highway. Also while the winter season and spring season sucked in Horizon 4, they were still a cool aspect and nice change of scenery.

author: Danx98
review: Bugs on week 1 are to be expected. But when the bugs are copy pasted from FH4 it just goes to show that they simply don't care about the server issues they promised to fix. The gameplay itself is fun and the map and tracks are fantastic. Engine sounds are much better. It's just everything surrounding the game that's problematic. Here's some of the issues you'll come across online:-Endless loading screens for online races. (exact same issue as in fh4)-Power doesn't cost pi for some rwd cars and they have even more grip than in fh4. Those builds can be up to 3-10 seconds faster on certain tracks-Starting event lab races that you created won't show added props for other players in the raceIt just feels like the alpha patch for the game. Clearly they did no testing for these issues or they ignored them. They always seem to neglect anything to do with online racing. They even removed GOOD features from fh4 such as ranked and custom adventure while adding nothing. So now you're forced into doing races you don't want to do like s2 CC (which has 0 cars that reach 998). I don't understand how things like this can be overlooked. In summary, if you enjoy racing online just give this game a miss until it's fixed and the CORE ENDGAME FEATURES from fh4 are added back in. Even if you enjoy just doing rivals then good luck, there are many easy exploits for rivals times that are allowed by the in game systems. Games nowadays don't seem to do any testing and it's unacceptable.

author: Legoshi Sama
review: IMPORTANT IF YOU'RE A FORZA ARTIST MOVING FROM HORIZON 4 ON THE MICROSOFT STORE/XBOX! Importing is in no way supported, so do not be a fool like me and buy on here, buy from the Microsoft Store/xbox so your hard spent time isn't wasted. The game is fantastic, genuinely. But it's a huge hit, extremely upsetting to know all my work poured into 4 is now essentially lost. Getting flashbacks to Motorsport 2 when 3 came out. I do not reccomend you buy the game on Steam if again you're an artist that worked on Horizon 4 on the WIndows Store/Xbox, or a tuner, livery designer. Basically anything of a creative nature.

author: Rada
review: Would've been a decent game if they didn't pander to 12 years old with ADHD on cocaine so hard. The game has a lot to like about it: great graphics, great sound, very wide collection of cars that all feel quite different, driving is satisfying and the map is big and has a bit of everything. However, it's absolutely ruined for me because the game constantly throws things at me I don't want and can't turn off:The game hijacks control and opens the map when I get some unlocks.The game automatically starts challenges when I drive through areas where they're set up. This also removes collision with other cars (you can just drive through them), changes my destination on the GPS and triggers various visual effects, sounds and cringey dialogues, completely breaking immersion.The game constantly reminds me I'm not playing in online mode. And that this or that game mode exists. And that I can send cars to people. And all kinds of other useless crap I don't care about. These are just a few things off the top of my head. If I were to jump in the game and drive around for 10 minutes Im sure I could find more. I get that the game is supposed to be an arcade and not a driving simulation, but there's no reason in not letting the player opting out of being constantly accosted with things he doesn't care about.This isn't even getting into the awful writing pertaining any line of dialogue, scripted event, cutscene and story point. Everything that happens in this game tells you how amazing of a driver and person you, the player are. You can hardly find an interaction with a character that doesn't at least mention how you're the best driver in the world. Whenever you turn on the radio you're gonna find some "news" about how you're such a legends. All the cutscenes and scripted events are so grand in scale and hype that they remove any sense of realism or immersion you might have had left. Hell, there are even scripted races where you're slightly behind the entire race then make a miraculous recovery and get in the first place meters away from the finish line, no matter how good or bad you were driving. And it's not an isolated event, it happens over and over and over again, as if the player is too stupid to realize what's happening.For the same reason, I suspect, the progression in this game is messed up. You get your first supercar as soon as you start the game. Within a few hours of playing the game you already have more supercars than a billionaire obsessed with them and everyone refers to you as the best driver in the world.The annoying part is that they had a good game at some point in development. But then they created a bunch of content that seemingly came out of a chinese mobile game and shoved it down the players throat. It blows my mind that over a year after the release they still didn't give us the option to turn all of it off. The game, as it is now has enough good to keep me coming back once in a while to drive around a bit, but I always close it with a bitter taste in my mouth because of all the extra â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ I can't turn off and embarrassed that I spent time and money on a game designed to make children feel good about themselves.

author: ///Î›quarious
review: The best open-world racing game to date. Gorgeous graphics, great sound design & soundtrack, and an extremely detailed world to play in. Handling got a huge step up from Horizon 4, especially when playing on a wheel.Is it perfect? No, nothing is. But this gets very very close.

author: Hyokkuda
review: Honestly, I was not really looking forward to driving around Mexico as I was in Forza Horizon 4 with Great Britain because there's too much off-roading going on for me in this game.This game feels like a copy/pasted version of its predecessor with a few upgrades & downgrades of the core mechanics, but that's not an entirely bad thing. As a completionist, every race, every objective I try to beat, new ones are appearing on the map like there is no end to it just like the previous game, which is nice! There can be so many icons on the map that I have to use the filter once again to see where everything I need is. If you're like me, and you've played FH4 then you might be disappointed with this one because a lot of "Hard to Find" vehicle can now be purchased straight from the autoshow. A lot of them are no longer locked behind races or by doing events or behind a wheelspin.Some cars that can only be earned by reaching certain levels or from different driving series like road racing, cross-country, dirt, drag racing, street racing,, drift, speed traps, danger zones for crazy jumps and speed zones. Others cars can be earned by just completing a car collection or by driving around the map & destroying private properties or kicking dirt with drift & burnouts in someone's yard & windows, or simply by driving recklessly & pulling dangerous near misses & stunts to increase various parts of the "Horizon Life" experience & reputation.The progression is measured by an "Accolades" system & a level system. The more accolades points people earn, the higher their level is with a max level of 2999 or 10 â˜… (prestige) still. Each action the player does in the game will be rewarding, including ramming into your neighbor's fences! I don't recommend doing that in real life, however. No matter how much you hate your neighbor. "APs" can be earned with the following steps I mentioned above and by showing off your taste & even your artistic skills. Taking enough pictures of cars or the beautiful scenery will give the player more points. But the same goes for creating some 3000-layer-stunningly good-looking paint jobs for a car of the player's choice to help them earn money & Accolades. On top of that, if you are a mechanic expert, then by customizing & tuning vehicles, it's possible to become famous & rich among other players by sharing the best tuning setups to make a car drive better. The same goes for creating paint jobs or just small stickers for everyone to use. So, in case you have none of those skills in you, you can always search for various stickers to put together & create your dream car and download someone's tunes to help you progress through a race you hate so much because the only car you own for a specific class requirement happens to feel like a boat.The UI is kind of bad. A grid rather than a slider feels like it's too much work when you just want to install the best of everything in the custom upgrade menu. This was originally a console game in mind, so I don't get those bad cursor UI designs in games.And speaking of skills! If you're the kind of person who sucks at every racing game, you're just terrified of touching a simulator game because they're often too hard for you, well you shouldn't be scared. After all, you can always adjust the game difficulty along with the AI difficulty & turn them into brainless drivers. If that's not enough for you, there's even an option for assisted steering & brakes, which will pretty much turn the car for you & slow down before every turn. Although I don't know anyone who would use that, but hey! It's optional! Difficulty bonus can no longer go beyond 100%. Shifting set to manual, driving line, damage & tire wear, rewind no longer affect the difficulty bonus CR which is a shame in my opinion.Now back to creativity & AI for a moment. Those who are creative or even cheap & non-competitive can abuse this creation system by creating their race & drive around the map, drawing the race lines they want & the AI will follow. Other players, too, if they don't realize what you've been up to by creating a race track while drunk, ramming into every tree, trash cans & street lights. I'm telling you, the AI will follow! The traffic won't go away while creating them, by the way, so you can also tell whenever someone just crashed into a car while creating the race just because the line will suddenly have a Z in it.As mentioned earlier, there's a lot to be done in this game. There's a form of story mode related to Horizon Festival, but more is to be done even after completing those. So, a Festival playlist consists of completing multiple race events to increase the progression gauge up to 100 PTS for a "Hard to Find" car, or an access pass to new events & up to 160 PTS for a legendary "Hard to Find" vehicle, just like the previous game. That's the main "story." Then there's also a seasonal event that lasts about two weeks with another completion rate of 25 PTS & 40 PTS for random vehicles, which can also be purchased from other players at the auction house for those who hate grinding or for less-skilled players or even received as a gift now thanks to that new feature.Almost everything can be played with friends & strangers, either in co-op or against each other. I haven't played a lot of multiplayer modes this time around.Those who want to own everything in the game will have to work for it. Certain vehicles, horns, character accessories, clothes &... stupid dance moves can only be acquired by purchasing them with Forza Points (FP) from the Forzathon Shop. To earn points, the player must participate in a live group event that occurs randomly on the map. Everyone must participate to earn those points. But not to worry! There's nothing competitive about that event. It's similar to Burnout Paradise's online challenges if you ever played that game. As for the character appearance, the player will be greeted with a character customization menu at the beginning of the game with 25 characters presets to choose from, the ability to change the hairstyle, and hair color, add prosthetic arms/legs, identity to be addressed as "he/him, she/her, they/them". Along with two voice options for male & female. Now the character can speak. The player can change their character at any time from their home or from the Horizon Festival. As for clothes like tops, jackets, dresses, legs, ankles for socks, face masks, outfits & accessories, a lot of them will be locked behind a completion system. But it can be unlocked with wheel spins & super wheelspins, which is some form of loot boxes that can be earned pretty quickly by just leveling up (Similar to the Overwatch loot box system, if you ever played that). Lastly, the player can also buy houses, beach houses and some rich-looking houses. Houses, houses everywhere. They don't do much other than looking great or bragging rights and setting the player closer to the desired location on the map. Some will give special perks, however, like double Forzathon points or the ability to fast travel.And lastly, the new weather system. But nothing too fancy. I barely noticed any storms outside of the prologue.Well, that's about it for now! I hope that this review was helpful to you! And I'm sincerely sorry for this wall of text! Feel free to comment down below if you want to know more about the game, or if you wish to correct something I said, even though you probably own the game already & you're just a curious person! Either way, I appreciate it!

author: Nismo.
review: Yes, yes... Sure, this is just a DLC to Horizon 4, but listen up.Could you drive Porsches in Horizon 4, or any of the previous titles, without the constant fear of death? No.Could you drive an Acura Integra without it feeling like someone put dinner trays under the rear wheels without you noticing? No.Horizon 5 has FINALLY, after pretty much 12 years since the release of FM3, made driving with this physics model/engine feel good and intuitive.For me that's all that Horizon 4 was missing, decent driving physics.Now, the game is still a sim-cade, more towards sim, with its own twist on what is considered "realistic".Take for example, all cars still feel heavier than they should, they rotate slower than you'd expect, more noticeable in cars that are extremely light.This definitely has its advantages, playing on a gamepad or even keyboard is made easier because the cars aren't super twitchy allowing more people with different driving styles to still succeed at the game.Keep in mind, playing this game on a wheel may feel rather disconnected due to this style they went for.All-in-all, Horizon 5 is a great way to say goodbye to this physics model, if the Motorsport reboot changes this (and I hope they do), and I'm really glad it exists.Gameplay wise, it's very close to Horizon 4. Open world, race what you want when you want, do the festival playlist, etc.Now you have the accolades, small achievements to complete, but once you're done with the ones that give you good rewards there isn't much else to do than the usual cycle of "Tune car, try it online".Speaking of the accolades, they found it a good idea to have some tied to vinyl downloads, tune downloads, and so on, which is great for completionists who don't have a platform to just boost their numbers...I wholeheartedly recommend this game if you're looking for a fun experience with cars in a very nice and diverse map.I wouldn't recommend this game if you're looking for fair competitive racing because their car performance measuring system is clearly not up to the task anymore, but if you don't mind sticking to a broken META, you should be just fine.TL;DRFinally, good driving physicsIt's almost like Horizon 4, but better gameplay in generalBuy if you want to have funDon't buy if you want fair competitive racing

author: Avsemsom
review: This game was almost good for about 3 weeks after release ("almost" because of the connectivity issues, and because of those issues the game felt dead). After those 3 weeks, it has felt painfully like a reskin of Forza Horizon 4, on every level. FH4 even had better houses, a better map, since the seasons changing kept it exciting in my opinion.That said, Forza Horizon 5 is still a really good and quality car game, but it should have offered more, and I feel like the new Hot Wheels DLC just adds insult to injury, that injury being that this game barely offered anything new.

author: Xx_swaglord_xX
review: This is a great game mind you. But ONLY, if you like driving around and doing nothing of impact and meaning. The world is great, the cars GREAT, handling is arcadey which is all right. But its not engaging, it feels empty it feels like a true sandbox. This game is nothing but filled with sand.

author: Mochigan
review: Forza is now the "best racing game ever" but with every single new game, they are going backwards. Recycled Festival Playlist rewards, loss of small details such as glowing brake pads and pedal shifters, no proper Mexican cars or cars that are famous in Mexico. It's just a recycled game that has less details. This "best racing game" has no soul, it's just a fun driving game that lets you experience different cars. Don't get me wrong, I'm having fun with it. New engine sounds are great. Mexico is a really good map for the game. Accolades are keeping me busy. But with new racing games coming this year, Forza will be dead. Developers are lazy because they have no real competition at the moment.I'm rooting for new Test Drive and Need for Speed 2022.

author: Dirtman
review: This is certainly a game for everyone. No matter if you are an adult, teen, kid, or a graybeard, if you are a professional IRL driver, simracing veteran or you have never touched a virtual steering wheel before - you will find this game amazing and enjoyable. Forza Horizon 5 brings you an amazing open-world driving and racing sandbox experience surrounded by stunning graphics and tons of vehicles. There is something for everyone. Real hypercars, muscle cars, rally cars, drift cars, hot hatches, buggies, and even trucks are at your disposal. There are more than 500 vehicles and new ones are constantly being added. You can race on the road, drift, go offroad, play the campaign, do the side quests or just drive around and explore Mexico - you can have fun as you want. There are online and offline races, meaning that if you're not too experienced in racing games you can lower your difficulty level and just enjoy your drive with easy bots that won't leave you 10 km behind. Forza Horizon is all about freedom and having fun with cars.The graphics are stunning, this is clearly one of the best-looking games in 2021. The landscapes, VFXs (like smoke and water splashes), biomes, and Mexico towns... Just sit down and admire. The game has been released on older console generations (Xbox One) which unfortunately downgrades the graphics experience and raytracing is available in the Forzavista only (however, I think it isn't too good - i have an RTX 3060 Ti, so I have raytracing, but it hadn't impressed me too much). The car sounds are very good, they are definitely improved from the Forza Horizon 4. I still think they need some upgrades though. Character voiceovers are cool (real Mexican actors dubbed the Mexican in-game charachters) and the music is fine too (I liked FH4 radio stations more, but it's a matter of taste). And finally - our own charachter has a voice too!The story is about a Horizon Festival and the different activities around it. You are the Horizon Superstar, the most known person here and you are helping to build this show. The story isn't too long, but it's only the addition to the game. You get access to the next chapters by collecting accolades (which you get for progressing in the game). You can complete it in around 20 hours without speedrunning). The game itself can be played indefinitely - it's never-ending and always expanding!The game has a few issues and bugs, but Playground Games is often releasing updates with bugfixes. The game requires a pretty fast PC, it runs at around 70-90 FPS on my PC (Ryzen 5 3600, RTX 3060 Ti, 16 GB RAM, installed on SSD) with Ultra/Extreme (highest possible) settings at 2560x1440p (2K) resolution. Occasional lags or errors happen, but I have never experienced any crashes or other bigger problems. Talking about the price - simply, it's worth it. Even at the full price. You get an amazing game with a lot of content and features. I pre-ordered the Premium Edition and I'm not disappointed. Go buy it now!

author: DrSpringroll
review: I've loved all of the Forza Horizon games since 1 played them all on Xbox though and this is my first PC version, I have to say it's "similar" to 4 but the graphics are better, the cars and the environment look stunning even on medium graphics if you don't want to destroy your computer with Ultra or High, the story is kind of annoying with all the cut scenes every 5 minutes and your character talking gets on your nerves after a while, apart from that the actual racing and cars are top notch and it feels great to just tear down the streets of Mexico in a Chevy hitting speeds of 200KpH+There are loads of missions and races to do as well so you'll never really get bored, plus the main story has many branches with the baja, street, off-road and many more which you progress through, there are accolades and cosmetics as well if that's your thing.The car variety is excellent something like 600-800 cars, only a handful of them being fictionalised (hot-wheels).There is a ton of DLCs/Expansions as well with the latest being the rally adventure, plus like 50 something more which some come with the game depending what edition you buy. I would recommend trying to get the game on sale as well as it is on the expensive side at full price.All in all 9/10 couple of bugs and freezes rarely though, awesome game cool cars.Played with: Intel Core-i7 11800-H processor, NVIDIA Geforce RTX 3050-Ti, 16 GB RAM

author: Mr. Mistake
review: Forza Horizon 5 (FH5) is essentially FH3, and it makes very little effort to hide that. Having skipped FH4, FH5 makes me glad to have done so. In 30 hours of playtime (at the time of writing), the only differences I've found between FH5 and FH3 are a few set-pieces and the map. That's just not good enough. FH5 and FH3 feel exactly the same in all the ways that matter. I'm wondering if some of the people writing the glowing reviews it has been getting have played the previous games.Why haven't I refunded it? Because I enjoy the livery editor and I love cars. This is what Forza Horizon 5 capitalizes on.I guess I'll keep playing, but I'll probably be skipping FH6.Thanks for reading.

author: Volvo In Disguise
review: Ford Puma is a nameplate used by various different Ford Motor Company vehicles and engines. The name was first used from 1997 to 2001 on a sport compact. The revival of the nameplate was announced at the Go Further event in Amsterdam, Netherlands, and its new usage began on a new subcompact crossover SUV model in 2019. Ford also uses the Puma name on variants of the Duratorq engine.Ford products using the Puma nameplate are:Ford Puma (sport compact), a 1997â€“2001 sport compactFord Puma (crossover), a 2019â€“present subcompact crossoverFord Puma Rally1, a 2022 Rally1 car built by the M-Sport Ford World Rally TeamFord Escort RS2000, originally intended to be called the Puma[1]Ford Duratorq ZSD "Puma", a line of 2.0 L, 2.2 L, and 2.4 L engines

author: iMatrix7
review: Like Forza Horizon 4 basically, with less cars, more bugs and a new map!!I only recommend the game if you intend to play it ignoring all the bugs included.[EDIT 10.04.2022]Game is still very broken!- Horizon Open is completely broken. It's more than a week that there is a glitch that permits some cars to go way faster then the other cars. Devs are not fixing this quickly.- Online services for convoys and social life is still malfunctioning. This means that you will have often problems to see players in your convoy, that you have to recreate convoys when this happens, and that sometime you will have to start a race with not all the players in your convoy. Also, not all the players are usually visible in your map, some of them will only spawn very close to you.- Horizon Radios are very limited. Prepare your Spotify playlists if you want more kinds of music in your game.- VIP benefits are broken. There is a very strong possibility that you could not be able to have those.- Longevity of the game is very short. Once you complete the story, expect to do always the same things, just like in FH4. Weekly series are very short and only last 2 / 3 hours. Lots of bugs in these challenges too.- Not enough updates from Playground to refresh and/or fix the game.

author: Khaeops
review: Lifeless and lazy, is what I'd have to call this game.I tried really hard to get used to it and enjoy it, but at the end of the road, there really isn't any content in this game. I found myself constantly saying "Need for Speed did it better" at every corner of the game despite NFS not being particularly  groundbreaking either. The UI in FH5 is terrible - it's slow, doesn't make much sense and there's dozens of redundant prompts that get in the way every 5 minutes. Your party leader might queue you up for a race, but you're so deep in UIs that by the time you can back out of all the menus the 10 second (yeah, only 10) timer to accept the event runs out, and you get kicked from the party and everyone has to exit and re-party up again.The sound design of the cars is lifeless. Cars are tinny and there's little to no bass in any of them. To call it 'award-winning' is a joke. And don't get me started on the balancing. This is one of the most unbalanced, or stupidly balanced games I've ever played. Sure, the game gives you over 600 cars to choose from, but only about 10 of them are actually competitive, while the rest might have the same rating as another player's car but only have half the top speed, or slide out uncontrollably on near-straights.There are a very limited amount of race courses in this game, with the devs opting to allow the community to foster their own tracks and have them curated on front pages and in weekly challenges. The problem is people make awful tracks. I just want tracks that flow and have readable/sensible corners, with walls or props that indicate a clear direction. Instead, you get these wonky tracks with no walls or indication whatsoever to where you need to turn, so you spend the entire race staring at your GPS/minimap in the bottom corner of the screen rather than on the road.The story is pretty lacklustre as well, not to mention how 'happy' everything is. Everyone's way too cheerful and the dialogue is cringe. I'd rather not have the story at all to be honest. But it doesn't last long and after a handful of 'races' with random challenges you're on your own to just do whatever. There's no drive to do anything. Now, the game has some good parts to it as well. I very much prefer its physics over Need for Speed, and it's kinda pretty. But that's about it to be honest.I've played this game mainly as a social outlet to play with a couple of friends, and that's really what this game is. It's a social experience with racing, rather than a racing game with friends. But it even contradicts itself in that, as your interactivity with other players is very limited. To remove toxicity, there's no open chat, only a very limited chat system where you get 4 context-sensitive chat messages you can send, but you have to WIN them in lootboxes this game calls 'wheelspins'. You can't send cars or money to your friends without buying them with premium currency - speaking of which, I don't think you can even buy the 'premium' currency. They look like they're special, but you just get them from doing a bunch of dumb challenges.Buy it on sale if you have a bunch of friends who would be happy to join you, or if you're a car fanatic or just want to drive around for a while. But if you're looking for a serious racing game to play, this is 100% not it. Get any Need for Speed if you want basically everything mentioned in this review done significantly better minus the physics, or buy Assetto Corsa if you desire the physics and an open playground.

author: atroxell97
review: I don't play this game much, but me and my brother have played every Forza since FM2, and this is the worst Horizon by far...up there with FM6 and 7.From even reading the Forums, it seems like the developer just gave up fixing the game. XP boards are bugged, game design and gameplay are just not thought through, and drivatar mechanics are completely screwed up.It seems like there wasn't much though between "making it a challenge" and "just making it harder". Anything above average difficulty makes it seem like the front running drivatars are a Performance class above, and the backmarkers are Stock cars with good drivers. As a casual player, it makes it frustrating to try and hop back in, do some seasonal events, and the drivatars are locked to Highly Skilled.Also, it's not just the drivatars that make this game frustrating...PR Stunt (Danger signs, Speed Zones/Traps, etc) placement wasnt thought out. You'll be doing a danger sign where you jump straight into buildings, trees, unlandable terrain, the speed zone by the main festival goes through the exit to the site from one direction, trailblazers are overly difficult...the only stunt still making me want to play is the drift zones.This game by itself is fun, but if you try to do events, or don't grind every day, I would not recommend this Horizon. It seems like Playground Games knows they can make money just by releasing a new Horizon, which is why i waited a year to even consider buying it on sale half off. A year later, it doesn't seem like any work was put, and FH3, FH4, and FH5 all cost same price.

author: DeZoTriX
review: GOTY - Weak dialogue for a wider audience but as an car enthusiast this game is a must! Absolutely stunning visuals and super detailed car models from a huge selection of vehicles. Driving physics with a controller feel  amazing, even if you're not the racing game type of player. Only real downside as of doing this review are the multiplayer issues, meaning friends in a convoy disappear and reappear on a constant basis, also the online events such as 'Horizon Arcade' are barely able to be completed since some servers are just plain empty or other drivers are not visible. I would say that the latter problem will be fixed pretty soon due to being such a newly released title. Optimization wise FH5 is probably one the best games released this year considering the graphics, but that wasn't that difficult in 2021, but props where props are due, 'Playground Games' did an amazing job on this new sequel in the 'Horizon' series.Post Patch (December): 'Horizon Arcade' seems to be somewhat fixed due to it now being scaled down to the amount of players participating in the event which means they are achievable solo fairly easily. Convoys were patched as well, there's no disappearing issue, however either the convoy leader or the members can't see each other completely. Will probably still need some patience for this to work solid. - Fixed!First Expansion - Hot Wheels: This is one of the best DLC's I've ever played in any game! If you've never got to experience it in Forza Horizon 3 like me, definitely grab it for FH5.
